column4: mike10, try resizing the deluge window out a bit, adjust panes, see if you get a refresh which gets all your files displayed again.
ali, I might now
ali, adjust your ethernet interface with ethtool, was talking about it just a few seconds ago
!ethtool > ali1234
i'll give it a go, but i'm not using samba
doesn't matter, ethtool is for all your network connections
where network==ethernet
i know. but for me samba connections have always been slow. most other stuff normally isn't.
if most of the other stuff is just dealing with web pages, etc, you might not realize it because of the data sizes involved.
most of the other stuff involves transfering raw digital video
try ifconfig and see if you have any errors
no errors
so you are saying you have a problem with samba connecting to an external server, correct?
check that the settings on the other end, on the server, are good too.
no, not at all. i'm not using samba at all
then please explain your problem clearly.
the problem is that any kind of tcp/ip connection will stall after about 50kb, and the total maximum throughput of the 100mbit card is currently 4kbyte/sec
as in, http, ftp, ssh, anything really
3, not including the ones that are turned off. and one is the router.
and what about that 1 other computer you have, can you connect to everything from there fine?
none of the other computers on this network have a problem?
